page.title: 04Living in Sydling.
page.content: Life for the population of Sydling revolves around their familiess and their homes. The young mothers tend to stay at home with their babies until the children reach school age. They help run playschool and a few work at home or have a part time job in the village. Nearly half the village population are over 50 and almost a quarter are over 65. A high proportion off the villagers have lived here less than eight years and the majority have lived here less than 15 years. There are 18 people whose parentage is entirely Sydling stock and 4 whose fathers were born in the village (1890-1900). Sydling is inhabited mostly by country folk but the newcomers tend to come from cities or large townss. It is a friendly and welcoming village and mostpeople join in all social events.
